intro: Wahlenbergia littoricola, commonly known as the coastal bellflower, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along the shoreline, thriving in saline and well-drained environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom from late winter to early spring. Wahlenbergia littoricola is well adapted to coastal conditions, with features that help it withstand salt spray and strong winds.
